To Play: The person who spun and drew the lowest number gun goes first. They spin the spinner and move their gun the number of spaces as indicated along the animal tracks. When a hunter reaches a stop or go card they follow what is printed on the card. The first hunter to follow the correct path and find an animal card gets to keep it and lay out a new trail with another animal (or use the same trail if desired)

Name: Arkham Horror: Miskatonic Horror Expansion
Description:
Game description from the publisher:

A recent find at Miskatonic University has unearthed even more mysteries pertaining to the strange happenings in Arkham, Massachusetts. While the worshippers of the Ancient One grow in strength, the stalwart defenders of this sleepy town are put to the ultimate test.

The fight against the unknown forces of the cosmos is far from over, and those that thought they stood a chance against the mythos have a lesson to learn.

Miskatonic Horror is a new type of Arkham Horror expansion that builds upon the materials found in the ample library of other Arkham Horror expansions. While the components and rules found in Miskatonic Horror can be enjoyed with only the Arkham Horror base game, the more expansions you incorporate, the more aspects of Miskatonic Horror you can enjoy.

With nearly 450 new cards, Miskatonic Horror includes:

• New Skill, Gate, and Mythos cards for the Arkham Horror base game.
    • Additional Exhibit Item cards for Curse of the Dark Pharaoh.
    • New Injury, Madness, Dunwich Location, and Dunwich Horror cards for Dunwich Horror, as well as an all new Dunwich Horror Herald sheet.
    • More Blight and Act cards for The King in Yellow.
    • New Kingsport Location, Epic Battle, Blessings of Noden, and Visions of Hypnos cards for Kingsport Horror.
    • Over 20 new Cult Encounter cards for The Black Goat of the Woods.
    • New Innsmouth Location and Innsmouth Look cards for Innsmouth Horror.
    • Additional Relationship cards and Reckoning cards for Lurker at the Threshold.
    • Plus new Player reference sheets and a new Institution variant!
Families: Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Geschlossene Gesellschaft
Description:
Paper-and-pencil game where players try to score the most points by covering square or rectangular groups of fields in an 8x8 board; each coloured field scores 1 point. Of course each player plays a different colour/symbol, and there can be no overlaps. The game should be played in several rounds, each one with a different starting player.

Each turn players throw a die and colour the corresponding number of fields on the board; these must be orthogonally connected and so build a group, which doesn't have to be a straight line. Players can decide when to stop throwing - if a player can't colour the mandatory squares after a throw they leave the round with no score.

Name: EndBreaker! SCG: Build & Break
Description:
In EndBreaker! SCG: Build & Break, a deck-building and card-selecting game, you are a leader of a brigade of EndBreakers, those who can gaze into the eyes of others and see their ending in a scene from that person's new future, with critical implications.

This game is set in Lanceburg, one of the city states of the world of EndBreakers, a world threatened by the Masquerades: those possessed by a mysterious power, the Thorns. You recruit party-members (Job cards) in the tavern, learn powerful skills (Ability cards), clear missions (Scenario cards) and battle against monstrous evils (Masquerade cards). You earn victory points (Dalc cards) by clearing scenarios or winning battles.

The Masquerade cards are revealed one by one during game play, and each player must fight this monster, earning VP according to how well they do. After three battles are resolved, the game ends and the player with the most VPs wins.

Name: Mexican Chess
Description:
Chess variant played on a 10x10 board, where pawns can start moving up to three spaces forward instead of the traditional two spaces, and where there's a new piece, the Conquistador, placed between the Knight and the Bishop, that moves almost like a Knight: two spaces forward orthogonally followed by one space forward diagonally.

The game was developed in 1965 but it has never been commercially released.
